boat.full_description:
From the 1973 Clyde Race book:

Owned by Duncan MoKERREL of Gourock. Built in 1894, by A. ROBERTSON of Sandbank to the design of G.L. WATSON of Glasgow. Originally a Gaff Cutter ahe appears in Lloyds to have become a Sloop rigged in 1909 with sails by MCKENZIE. L.O.A. 22.4' with a 22.0' waterline and a beam of 7.3'. She was built with a lead keel and draws 4.6'. Constructed of yellow pine and oak. The decks have now been covered by Trakmark. She was privately owned by Mг. GILCHRIST of Fairlie ard again before that by Alistair GARVIE who is believed to be sailing out of Tobermory with a charter boat.
boat.name: Camilla
boat.short_description: Camilla was built in 1894 by Alexander Robertson at his yard in Sandbank, Argyll.
